```{r RchunkTitle}

# This R code is displayed in the document because I didn't add
# "include = FALSE" as a paramter in the above.

# Create fake table data.
table.data <- data.frame(Matcher = paste0("matcher", LETTERS[1:6]),
                         FNIR    = signif(10 ^ -(4 + rnorm(6)), 2))

# Sort rows by FNIR.
table.data <- table.data[order(table.data$FNIR),]

# Display the table.
# NOTE: 'tb' places buttons below table ('bt' flips their order).
# NOTE: The final 'formatStyle' call shrinks the column name text.
# NOTE: %>% is an offensive operator defined in the 'magrittr' package
#       that allows you to daisychain function calls together. I try to
#       avoid it.
datatable(table.data, list(dom = 'tB', buttons = c('csv', 'pdf', 'print')),
          caption = "Leaderboard", extensions = 'Buttons', escape = FALSE,
          rownames = FALSE) %>%
formatStyle(colnames(table), 'text-align' = 'center', fontSize = '90%')
```
